1.text: When Jesus came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

2.text: Behold, a leper came to him and expressed adoration to him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean!”

3.text: Jesus stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, “I want to! Be made clean.” Immediately, this man’s leprosy was cleansed.

4.text: Jesus then said to him, “Do not tell anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

5.text: When Jesus came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, imploring him

6.text: and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.”

7.text: Jesus answered, “I will come and heal him.”

8.text: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy that you should come under my roof! Only say the word and my servant shall be healed.

9.text: As it is, I am also a man under authority, having soldiers under my own authority. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and if I tell another, ‘Come,’ he comes. Or if I tell my servant, ‘Do this,’ he does it!”

10.text: When Jesus heard this, he marveled and said to those who followed, “Amen, I tell you that I have never found so great a faith, not even in Israel!

11.text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven.

12.text: But the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness and there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

13.text: Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed.” And his servant was healed in that hour.

14.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law lying sick with a fever.

15.text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and served him.

16.text: When evening came, many who were possessed with demons were brought to him. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.

17.text: Thus, what had been spoken through Isaias (Isaiah) the prophet was fulfilled:  He took our infirmities, and bore our diseases.

18.text: Now when Jesus saw great crowds around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

19.text: A scribe came and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go!”

20.text: Jesus replied, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”

21.text: Another of his disciples said to Jesus, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

22.text: But Jesus replied, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their [own] dead.”

23.text: When he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.

24.text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the waves swept over the boat, but Jesus was asleep.

25.text: His disciples came to him and woke him up, saying, “Save us, Lord! We are dying!”

26.text: He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then he stood up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

27.text: The men marveled, saying, “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

28.text: When Jesus arrived on the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two men possessed by demons met him there, coming out of the tombs. They were extremely violent, so much that nobody could pass that way.

29.text: Behold, they cried out, saying, “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

30.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding at some distance from them.

31.text: The demons begged him, saying, “If you cast us out, allow us to go away into the herd of pigs.”

32.text: He said to them, “Go!” The demons came out and went into the herd of pigs: and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea and died in the water.

33.text: Those who fed them fled and went into the city where they told everything, including what had happened to those who were possessed with demons.

34.text: Behold, the entire city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged that he would depart from their borders.
